definition: grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
settled/steady/stable
to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
variant of 肏[cao4]
old variant of 操[cao1]

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate
variant of 券[quan4]

sentences.english: Despite Ma's lead in the polls, he's not yet a shoo-in.
sentences.chinese: 尽管马英九在民调中领先，但他还不能说是稳操胜券。

sentences.english: You have the ball at your feet, don't miss the chance.
sentences.chinese: 你稳操胜券，不要错过这个机会。

sentences.english: He thought he would slam-dunk to compete with Hollifield.
sentences.chinese: 他认为在他与霍利菲尔德的比赛中他将稳操胜券。

definition: to be assured of success
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to plan in advance (idiom)/a card up one's sleeve/forewarned is forearmed
see 胸有成竹[xiong1 you3 cheng2 zhu2]
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to come prepared
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
victory is in sight
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
lit. to hold the pearl of wisdom (idiom)/fig. to be endowed with extraordinary intelligence
to be certain of victory/to be bound to prevail
odds of success/stratagem that ensures success/to be sure of success
to wait at one's ease for the exhausted enemy/to nurture one's strength and bide one's time (idiom)
